essay:

My main goal is to get better at working in a team and understanding what career path suits me best. I hope to learn from [LOCATION_REDACTED] who are passionate about their goals and get guidance from [LOCATION_REDACTED] can help me identify mine.

essay:
Technology, for me, has always been a way to make ideas tangible. I built my first Arduino-based robot in 9th grade and since then, engineering has become my passion. I’m drawn to computer engineering because it perfectly merges creativity with logic — allowing me to design solutions that actually work in the real world.

I want to specialize in embedded systems and automation. My dream is to design low-cost assistive technologies for people with disabilities. This motivation led me to start a robotics team at school, where we built a voice-controlled wheelchair that won a national award.

I believe I’d be a strong fit for your program because I don’t just chase grades — I chase growth. I’m looking for a place that challenges me to think critically, collaborate competitively, and build something that matters.
achievements:
1st Place, National Robotics Challenge [PHONE_REDACTED])

Founder, High [INSTITUTION_REDACTED], TechnoWorks Lab (IoT Prototype Development)

Volunteer, STEM Mentorship Program for Girls

Runner-up, National Coding Olympiad
